channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: A very large pothole in the road next to large tree, 28th October
item.description:
On the left coming from churchdown to the Reading’s just passed the house next to the large tree (in the field) before the farm
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Badgeworth Road, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface problem, 28th October
item.description:
I’d like to report a part of kerb which has come loose on Mersey Road, Cheltenham. GL52 5PH. As lots of vehicles park kerbside this could easily cause wheel or tyre damage as well as a trip hazard for pedestrians. I have attached an image of the kerb in its current state as well as a Google maps street view image of location. If you were able to arrange to get it fixed please as it seems to have completely come loose in the last day or so.
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Bridge is damaged/missing problem, 28th October
item.description:
supply wardens with 4 metre bridge and 1 handrail - old bridge has v ends. Deliver to Old House Farm for a tThursday workparty. There is also an old bridge that the farmer Russell Slatter 07934 367948, says is not far from the existing one which he would like us to take away. It sounds like it's an old one perhaps replaced a while back.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Post or sign leaning slightly (less than 20 degrees) problem, 28th October
item.description:
Please pass to relevant ahr covering this area. As part of routine annual inspection, found this sign post is leaning on footway. It is still solid within its foundations so not at risk of falling at the moment. Please consider replacing the post.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Hucclecote War Memorial Tidy Up in advance of Remembrance Sunday, 28th October
item.description:
We are approaching Remembrance Sunday, a very significant date on the Hucclecote calendar, as plans to parade along Hucclecote Rd to the War Memorial at the junction with Green Lane take shape. Each year more and more local groups attend to lay a wreath, or just to be part of this special day. Wreaths will be laid on behalf of the City Council and the County Council with hundreds of residents in attendance. The area has been fairly well maintained during the year and that is much appreciated. Could you please ensure that the vegetation in the immediate area is given a final ‘trim’ so that the Hucclecote War Memorial is looking its best on Armistice Day and Remembrance Sunday?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hucclecote Road, Hucclecote, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown trees, 28th October
